brief_description: Evaluate the variation in immune response between individuals and assess whether it changes as a function of age and similarity in genetic and environmental background (by comparing differences between monozygotic and dizygotic twin pairs of different ages).
brief_title: Monozygotic and Dizygotic Twin Pair T-Cell Responses to Influenza Vaccination SLVP018 2009
description: Evaluate the variation in immune response between individuals and assess whether it changes as a function of age and similarity in genetic and environmental background (by comparing differences between monozygotic and dizygotic twin pairs of different ages).
hypothesis: Explore how white blood cell subsets, serum cytokines, whole blood gene expression, and T cell signaling responses change with age and to what degree is this genetically determined.
objectives: test T-Cell Responses to Influenza Vaccination
official_title: Monozygotic and Dizygotic Twin Pair T-Cell Responses to Influenza Vaccination 2009

arm.description: 8-17 year old monozygotic twins randomly assigned within pair to receive either IIV3 or LAIV3
arm.name: SLVP018_2009A

arm.description: 18-30 year old monozygotic twins pairs given  LAIV3
arm.name: SLVP018_2009B

arm.description: 18-30 year old dizygotic twin pairs given  LAIV3
arm.name: SLVP018_2009C

arm.description: 40-49 year old monozygotic twin pairs given  LAIV3
arm.name: SLVP018_2009D

arm.description: 40-49 year old dizygotic twin pairs given  LAIV3
arm.name: SLVP018_2009E

arm.description: 70-100 year old monozygotic or dizygotic twin pairs given  IIV3
arm.name: SLVP018_2009F

pubmed.title: Variation in the human immune system is largely driven by non-heritable influences.

program.contract_name: Vaccination and infection: indicators of immunological health and responsiveness
